content: Thematic analysis is a method of analyzing qualitative data, such as text, interviews, or observations. It is used to identify and understand patterns and themes in the data. The process typically involves reading and re-reading the data to identify key themes, coding the data based on these themes, and then analyzing the data to understand the relationships between the themes. Thematic analysis is often used in social sciences research, such as anthropology, sociology, and psychology, to understand the experiences and perspectives of participants in a study. It is considered a flexible and adaptable method that can be used for a wide range of research questions and data types. Thematic analysis helps researcher to identify recurring patterns or themes in qualitative data, and helps to make sense of the information.
